text: Seems reasonable.
I haven't kept up with Standard (for many, obvious reasons), but from what I've heard from friends it's been a hell of a ride the past couple of years.
I liked vehciles in standard. Made the format fairly fun and super cheap/accessible. But end of the day its a 1v1 format...always preferred multiplayer lol
The best format

What cards has energy gotten banned? Reflector mage wasn't in the energy decks, copter was banned because it was in literal every deck, emrakul was because of marvel, but marvel was the problem. The only card that was banned because energy is "too good" is marvel, but marvel is a busted card regardless of what resource you put behind it
I don't get standard players.
They want powerful new cards but not too powerful. Something has got to be the best, you can't bitch when you want good cards and something stands out
End rant. Whatever. I'm grumpy this morning
They want all cards to be equally crazy high-powered, but they don't want their games to end out of nowhere.
Which is funny, because those energy decks now don't win out of nowhere
You get beaten down by a 2/2
They should all switch to the best high-powered format.
Legacy.
Ha, if they think energy is busted, wait until they get everything ruined by a deathrite shaman
Or Leovold
Or true name
Or...literally anything in the format
Eeeew
"Let's get Marvel banned! *tries legacy* let's get show and tell banned!"
Isn't that deck weak to sideboard hate?
Can be.
Game 1
Show and tell is like the affliction warlock of the format
Lab man if you will. Just mindless "oh, is this good?"
<@U6YMA7NAV> is affliction warlock still the faceroll caharacter of choice in WoW?
Fuck it. I'm playing Legacy Leylines.

<@U33EGB4TX> you misunderstand. The problem is energy powered threats but no real answers which is the biggest problem in Standard over the last couple of years. Modern is rife with answer cards so it’s a crazy unfair comparison.
Fuckin'...do it
<@U3QMCLQQG> that deck makes me smile such big smiles
Yeah, Henry, do you follow. MaRo's Tumblr?
In passing.
People were asking him why they didn't print energy hate. He said it was because it was a new mechanic, and they wanted it to be awesome and blah-de-blah
Plus that was at a time when design wasn't making any good answers to anything.
Same answer as always. That thinking gave us threats but no answers.

They just printed lots of answer cards though. [[vraska's contempt]] gets rid of stuff, fatal push etc. everyone is trying to play red damage based answers, which doesn't work when everything is growing bigger

attachments.fallback: Vraska's Contempt {2}{B}{B} // Instant // Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.

Instant
Exile target creature or planeswalker. You gain 2 life.
_It wasn't long before the taverns of High and Dry were full of whispers about the new captain who could turn a person to stone with a glance._
attachments.title: Vraska's Contempt {2}{B}{B}

text: Exactly
People don't play the color with the right answers
They JUST gave some answers in the last 2 sets because they couldn’t ignore the problem anymore.
Cast out, angel of sanctions, fairgrounds warden. Just play more white and black
"new players don't like answers because they feel bad."
Yea, that's dumb. That's holding players hands when they should be riding a bike without training wheels
Boo hoo. You have a gigantic enfranchised player base that can handle answers.
Print Counterspell in standard.
Remove everything.
They keep teetering back and forth between "play competitive FNM!" And "we love casuals, all players should enjoy this game casually!"

It’s also a long turn-around. They can’t just throw cards into sets as the timeline of magic sets is a fairly long one. People seem to expect issues to be resolved the set after complaints happen, but that’s not what is feasible
No, that's true, Mason
Just play hearthstone. The best deck changes every update
Still annoying, though.
Don't actually do that though

<@U6YMA7NAV> <@U33EGB4TX> Affliction was never a faceroll spec. Well, maybe in Mists or something, I never played then, but keeping perfect times on 5 dots and weaving bolts/drains in between? It's just baddie mages getting pissed that someone out deeped them doing something besides fireball spam
Again most of those listed were in the last 2 sets. Anguished Unmaking was in Standard forever but didn’t fit into one of the better archetypes so it didn’t see play.
BW didn’t have the good threats so it was better to be fast than answer 1 for 1.
Burning crusade time affliction warlock was totally faceroll. Especially in arena. Even hunters had to work a *little* to be ez mode
Lol
So silly
That's my last point of reference for wow, I am super out of touch since lich king came out
BC afflic had CoA, Corruption, Syphon, Immolate, Haunt all on different timers with bolt weave in between
And in pvp priest/mage/rouge was the comp in 3v3, or druid/pally in 2v2
I guess in generic battlegrounds where  you were just running around like a blind chicken you'd get feared and dotted to death.
Ok
Like I said, baddie mages crying "But I had worse dps! I was pressing my 3 key the whole time, too!"
I love how competitive magic players poo-poo Cyclonic Rift as a 'Casual/EDH card', yet a sorcery-speed version is good enough to show up in at the Standard Pro Tour.
Rift should be sorcery.
It's still a blow out.
It never did anything in standard itself. Point of reference is bad. If they had it now they wouldn't shut up about it. Competitive players gonna competitive
Rift could be a sorcery and it would lose the 1u option and it would still get played
Oh for sure.
Yes...we call that [[River's Rebuke]] :wink:

text: except it looses 'each opponent'
makes it less of a blowout but also draws less hate.

Of course they weren't going to print answers to energy though. Most of their mechanics fall face first it seems. Of course I'm sure they wanted some level of balance but I bet they were originally happy for how it stood when it first came out
But woe to that single opponent
I would guess Rift was created prior to Edh being a thing they though about with card creation. Return to Rav cards were probably being developed before the first commander set
Rift wasn’t a standard player at the time iirc even though blue control was huge
I guess with Supreme Verdict, Sphinx’s Rev, Detention Sphere and Aetherling they didn’t need Rift

Cyclonic rift is in EVERY blue colored deck I have. Regardless of the theme/setting/level.

I can't even say that about sol ring (although it's in almost all of them).

There's no reason not to have it. It's... just so good. So stupidly good. So ungodly stupidly good.
It should be banned.
There. I said it.
Of course I’ve said that before.

It's changed, but I could almost say the same about rite of rep. More janky and less of a "staple" but I just love it. 

I've actually won a lot of competitive games with it in my stax. I've rite of rep vyrn wing for 6 of em and beat people to death senselessly lol
Dying to 2/2s slowly while your spending 9 mana to cast a mana crypt is a sadistic but enjoying experience
I'm not sure i think Rift should be banned, but if they banned it I wouldn't mind a bit.

I view rift as a board wipe. Slightly better or slightly worse depending on the circumstances (with it obviously being much better ideally). 
It's devastating in competitive but it's eh in casual unless it's endgame
There's your next edhrec idea. All the authors on a podcast discussing rift lol
It’s a 1-sided board wipe at instant speed. That’s a beast of a different color than just calling it a boardwipe.
I will say I've survived Rifts before and lost games where I've successfully cast it, so it's not a Protean Hulk or Tooth and Nail where it's almost always just cast as an auto-win
Every deck needs a way to win. If you rift and kill everyone, the worst thing that happens is you shuffle up and go again. Same with Henry's other favorite card in [[triumph of the horde]]

text:
Again, it's ideally much better. Completely agree. However from the few areas I played in... unless you're "pro", most just throw it down like a wipe when they're on the defensive. 
Ideally it's a win con... but so is every win con lol
If anything rift is more convoluted because you need to throw it down AND have a presence, unlike other methods that are less or just has mana intensive
I do also think it isn't a feel bad card. You either secure a win in which case people shuffle up and play again, or you stop someone from winning in which case it is kinda like a board wipe.
I think the only real defense for it being banned or looked at with disgust is that it's blue... and blue is just evil
Vs. like Insurrection where you can do nothing and just win, or Mike/Trike where it feels undeserved.
Mike/Trike is so unimaginative that if that’s the best you can do why bother?
The fact that there's zero reason not to run it in every single deck you can is a huge ding against it
It's not even like UUU to make you not run it in 3+ color decks. It just fits everywhere
Exactly. It’s sooo easy to slash in any blue deck. Everyone sits there and says, are you going to Rift?
Also unless you’re in Blue you have almost 0 practical defense against it.
The modular factor shouldn't be forgotten, either. There's plenty of times that Insurrection is a dead draw, but I've seen people save themselves with a non-overloaded rift
Note I said practical vs ‘any’.
There's a few non-blue counters and Teferi's Protection and that's pretty much it

<@U4V5EHQ2G> you hit the nail on my biggest gripe with it. It’s “undercosted” for what it does, to me. 7 mana, 1 blue. It’s a hard reset for the game, for everyone except you, at instant speed. Compared to [[!In Garruk’s Wake]], a assymetrical wipe in a destruction color...
Exactly my point. And Teferi’s Protection is only a few months old.
And requires you to hold 3 mana free in a color not exactly known for holding a pile of mana free
And it’s also $20.
Alright, so we're banning it. I'll tell Sheldon
Unless it sours his favorite merlot he won’t care.
Fair points. You just owe me the 30-40 bucks for all the rifts I have if it gets banned lol
Assuming it's like still 5 dollars
So what's everyone's opinion on... sol ring? Dum dum duuuuuummmmm
is good
I wouldn't care if Sol Ring got banned, too, but I think if you ban Sol Ring Crypt and Vault have to go with it
I'm all for it because the availability and price is there. I'd cry if my 3 crypts were banned but I'd understand that at least
If it got banned, I wouldn’t miss it. I don’t really have any other feelings besides that.
The more competetive a meta gets the bigger deal it is

Only real feeling I have about it is against those who are insanely against it, calling it broken. It's not broken. It's a nice push... and something that really makes me feel like my opening hand is a random gamble... but that's it
Yeah. That's why I understand if crypt got the boot. It'd suck but at the same time it's a silly expensive must have for most competitive decks... opposed to the ring that just costs 4 dollars
It's good.
Getting that four drop commander out on turn 2 is pretty huge
It's an absolute must in competitive to have turn 1 ramp.
The fact that they keep including it in precons makes me think it's not getting banned anytime soon though
It won't, and shouldn't
It's that one push everyone gets

super late to the party but welcome <@U7VNVRSMC>. I personally think the shorter the ban list the better and would gladly have it only be ante cards, subgame/dexterity cards, and the couple things that are on there to prevent them from being the only game in town (Rofellos, B Brads, Emrakul, etc) everything else is finne
Thank you!
the format is already vintage light
may as well just let the self-policing happen and stop trying to do it yourselves
stuff like Sway of the Stars will get hated out of metas the same way decree of annihilation has and if not your meta is fine with it
Yeah I think with obvious exception the ban list should be as short as possible
also youre welcome
:smile:
like, Prime Time? Tinker? really who cares. there are already so many cards that if you resolve them they're winning you the game, why pick and choose. decks are naturally limited by being highlander
primetime and [[blade of selves]] sounds so sexy.

text: The banlist is already less than a percent of available cards. It’s really very, very short.

I wish self policing worked with magic players. There are way too many king neck beards though that suck at communication that I think we need a ban list. Even if we don't agree with everything there I think it's a necessary evil
I do think Hulk is beyond busted, but I'm also playing in a shop with 30+ players where people quite running it after a week because it was just boring
Magic players aren't necessarily known for being good communicators.
So self policing does work to a degree
<@U33EGB4TX> you're right to a degree but <@U4V5EHQ2G> made my point for me
I should say it can work
I play in a meetup in NYC
I bought four for cheap when it was unbanned but never put one in a deck.
I've played places where it wouldn't
Right, there are places thatbit would be just fine, I think that's a minority though
I always think back to the "casual" pod I sat in at GP Minneapolis with three Narset extra turns/combat steps decks where all three tried to combo out on turn 4
and it does work more often than not, you just have to be willing to be the bad guy so to speak and say that you won't play wiht that bs
idk, I have literal 0 relevant data on this
We're also in a little bit of a bubble here of people more into longer games
I wouldn't say casual necessarily, but generally nobody here is building t3 combo decks.

I agree that it's likely a necessary evil if you don't want to run into something in an unknown meta unexpectedly, but I appreciate in general that the committee is excorcising restraint on adding cards, even though it's a small fraction of the card pool, it is a very slippery slope logic-wise
holy shit typing is hard this morning
I don’t think anyone will ever accuse the rules committee of acting in haste.

I agree that the RC isn't the best at what they do. But the ban list gives people at least a rough idea of what they can expect so they don't sit down with complete strangers at a brand new shop and not ruin the night for 3 others.
Not in haste, maybe in poor taste though
Yes, that's a shot at Sheldon being uber persnickety
fair\
And only liming battle cruiser magic
Everyone has a different perspective and their actions have so much impact that what they consider is different than the armchair quarterbacking we do.
the RC isn't perfect, but I'm not sure WotC would do a better job since they don't always seem to understand the format
I don’t want WotC managing the banlist.
Nothing with people will ever be perfect. That’s impossible.
Oh for sure. I don't agree with what the RC does sometimes but I'd rather someone else make those decisions and take the blame.
The biggest commander scare I had was that window this summer when people were assuming they were taking it over due to the modo changes
There's also Ghostway and Eerie Interlude as anti Rift tech
Kinda. They don't save non-creatures though, and you'd lose your tokens too
But yeah, they're better than nothing

The only argument I've every seen for sol ring that I could understand is that it improves variance in games. It's just short of a mox imo. The argument that power should be unbanned comes rarely. At the end of the day it's a card that nets you one 1 additional mana on turn 1, with low opportunity cost, when it should not by current standards. It doesn't win the game, but I feel it vastly improves your chances. I would like it if WOTC tracked win/loss percentages on mtgo of turn one sol rings and decks with or without it.

I would like to see it banned. When the modo banned list was wacky it was a more predictable game set. Green was the early ramp deck and everyone else pretty much started on turn 2 with rocks and the subpar mana dorks.
The MTGO 1v1 banlist is so wacky. Ban the fast mana but Recurring Nightmare is okey-dokey.
No U cantrips for you!
<@U33EGB4TX> my wife is actually the bigger wow player. I just play stuff that looks cool. Like Worgens because werewolves are badass.
